Desc.entry: Prosecutes criminal cases resulting from police investigations. The decision to prosecute lies with the Crown Prosecution Service, not the police, and is based on two criteria, the evidential test, i.e. is there enough evidence to provide a realistic prospect of conviction, and the public interest test, i.e. is it in the public interest to prosecute.

Pubs.entry: Annual Report; Here For You, leaflet; Recruitment leaflet

DisabledAccess.entry: Lift, Induction loop in reception only

ContactName.entry: Naheed Hussain, Chief Crown Prosecutor/Andrew Illingworth, Area Business Manager

ProviderServiceDetails.entry: No direct public service for personal callers
